intro: Cystium sierrae, commonly known as Sierra broom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Cystium sierrae thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
